titles: [An essay toward settlement upon a sure foundation being a testimony for God in this] perillous time / by a few, who have been bewailing their own, and other abominations, and would not be comforted, until their Redeemer, who is holy, be exalted in righteousnesse, and his name which hath been so much blasphemed, be sanctified in the sight of the nations.
publisher: Printed for Giles Calvert at the black Spread-Eagle, at the west-end of Pauls,
notes: Annotation on Thomason copy: "An Essay toward settlement: &c"; "sept. 19.".
British Library copy cropped at head, with some loss of print.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
keywords: England and Wales. --  Parliament --  Early works to 1800.
